required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dehydration of Omafilcon A Contact Lenses Versus Delefilcon A Contact Lenses
clinical_study.official_title: Dehydration of Omafilcon A Contact Lenses Versus Delefilcon A Contact Lenses

brief_summary.textblock: The study will explore in vivo lens dehydration rates across a 12hr wear period for the study lenses.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will explore in vivo lens dehydration rates across a 12hr wear period for the study lenses. The primary outcome variable for this study is the loss in lens weight over the day, which will indicate the amount of dehydration that has occured.

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change in Water Content (Mean) of Omafilcon A and Delefilcon A
primary_outcome.description: Comparison between lens types up to and at 12 hours of wear for the absolute change in water content (WC).

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change in Water Content (Median) of Omafilcon A and Delefilcon A
primary_outcome.description: Comparison between lens types up to and at 12 hours of wear for the absolute change in water content (WC).

primary_outcome.measure: Moisture Retention (Mean) of Omafilcon A and Delefilcon A
primary_outcome.description: Comparison between lens types up to and at 12 hours of wear of moisture retention by measuring relative percentage dehydration (RPD).

primary_outcome.measure: Moisture Retention (Median) of Omafilcon A and Delefilcon A
primary_outcome.description: Comparison between lens types up to and at 12 hours of wear of moisture retention by measuring relative percentage dehydration (RPD).

arm_group.description: Each subject will be randomized to wear the test lens in one eye and control lens in the other eye (contra lateral design).
Each subject will be randomized to wear the test lens in one eye and control lens in the other eye (contra lateral design).

intervention.description: Each subject randomized to wear either the test or control in either the left of right eye.
Each subject randomized to wear either the test or control in either the left of right eye.

overall_official.affiliation: Director, Centre for Contact Lens Research

facility.name: University of Waterloo School of Optometry

group.title: Overall Participants
group.description: Each subject will be randomized to wear the test lens in one eye and control lens in the other eye (contra lateral design). omafilcon A: Each subject randomized to wear either the test or control in either the left of right eye. delefilcon A: Each subject randomized to wear either the test or control in either the left of right eye.

group.title: Overall Participants
group.description: Each subject will be randomized to wear the test lens in one eye and control lens in the other eye (contra lateral design). omafilcon A: Each subject randomized to wear either the test or control in either the left of right eye. delefilcon A: Each subject randomized to wear either the test or control in either the left of right eye.

outcome.title: Absolute Change in Water Content (Mean) of Omafilcon A and Delefilcon A
outcome.description: Comparison between lens types up to and at 12 hours of wear for the absolute change in water content (WC).
outcome.population: Because of the outliers across three participants, the sample size for statistical analysis is reduced to 18 pairs.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study. There IS an agreement between the Principal Investigator and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed. The investigators will not be permitted to publish or present at scientific meetings results obtained from the clinical study without prior written consent from the sponsor.
